name: 蕭榮修
objective: This course introduces students to probability, random variables and fundamental statistics. Topics include fundamental probability theory, random variables, distribution functions, Bernoulli, binomial, negative binomial, geometric, hypergeometric, and Poisson distributions. The other continuous topics covered are uniform, exponential, normal, gamma and beta distributions; joint distributions; properties of expectation, central limit theorem, Chebyshev inequality, and law of large numbers; fundamental statistics.
schedule:
1. Introduction and Review of Set Theory
2. Combinatorial Analysis
3. Axioms of Probability
4. Conditional Probability and Independence
5. Random Variables, Expected Value, and Variance
6. Discrete Random Variables - I
7. Discrete Random Variables - II
8. Discrete Random Variables - III
9. Mid-term Exam
10. Continuous Random Variables -I
11. Continuous Random Variables -II
12. Jointly Distributed Random Variables - I
13. Jointly Distributed Random Variables - II
14. Properties of Expectation
15. Limit Theorems
16. Introduction to Statistics for Data Science - I
17. Introduction to Statistics for Data Science - II
18. Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Attendance 10%
Assignments &  Quizzes 30%
Mid-term Exam 30%
Final Exam 30%
materials:
1. A First Course in Probability, Sheldon Ross, 8th ed., Pearson Prentice Hall, 2009. ISBN: 9780136033134.
2. Probability and Statistics for Engineering & Sciences, Jay L. Devore, 9th ed., Thomson, Brooks/Cole, ISBN：0-534-39933-9
3. Probability & Statistics for Engineers & Scientists, Walpole, Myers, Myers, Ye, 9th ed., Pearson Prentice Hall, ISBN：9781292161365.
